text: I think there are just a lot of miserable cunts out there that want everyone else to be as miserable as them

author: sadwer
text:
It's a weird feeling, I had to wait a week to watch The Rise of Skywalker so I was absolutely blasted with people hating on it for days before I saw it, and then in the theater I was on the edge of my seat the whole time. I loved every bit of it.

Internet fandom seems to totally ruin things for themselves by setting impossibly high standards.

author: Raidertck
text:
Same. I hated solo and the last Jedi, but I loved rogue one and the mandalorian. I also think the force awakens isn’t bad at all. And I thought that maybe Disney wouldn’t let a multi billion dollar purchase go down the drain.

But god damn. They did not care about that movie. It was one of the worst endings to a ‘saga’ that I have ever seen that was kick out of post production.

author: _heisenberg__
text:
I don’t even blame Disney, I blame JJ more. That dude had such a hard on for retconning Last Jedi so much.

I too hated last Jedi when it came out. Watched it again before ROS and honestly? I actually really like it. It did a lot of things I did not expect and I think did a good job of setting up what could’ve been a great 3rd movie.

But ya know, gotta shoehorn in on your left.

author: IvanTheGrim
text:
I don’t think disliking the Rise of Skywalker counts as having impossibly high standards, tbf. It barely holds continuity within itself, much less within the trilogy it’s a part of or Star Wars as a larger narrative.

You can like it if you want, but you’re also not some basement dwelling neckbeard because you like your movies to make sense every once and a while.

author: KillRockNRoll
text:
Yep. It’s the same toxic concept as the “if I can’t have the girl then no one can” trope.

It’s so bizarre and unnecessary. Why can’t people just... agree to disagree?

It’s ok to dislike Last Of Us II. It’s also ok to love it. It’s a video game.

Why do some people look for conspiracy theories that allegedly prove that nobody enjoyed the game?

Why is that a better mindset to have than, say....I don’t know... not letting strangers’ video game opinions be that upsetting?

I just don’t get it.
